comment.author: 91549360@N03
comment._content: Corner of Clare Street and Merrion Street Lower. Dublin maps.google.ie/maps?q=dame+street&hl=en&ll=53.341...

comment.author: 20727502@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/91549360@N03] That was my gut feel as well. Opp corner to American College and Davenport was my guess. And I was hoping to compare frontages (and chimney patterns) on the lefthand side of "Clare Street" though before declaring. However the protruding bay/balcony put me off. As did the bricked up arched window on top floor of same building. But the main concern was the fact that each house is three windows "wide" in this shot. (But pretty much everything on Clare street is [now] 2 windows "wide").

comment.author: 91549360@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/20727502@N00]  I think your right. Wherever it is, it is on a tram route ......... should narrow it down.

comment.author: 45618415@N05
comment._content: I think I recognise the unusual projecting window in that picture. Might it be Harcourt Street, with the cabs parked on Clonmel Street? I'm pretty sure the corner building & the bay window match. Can't get a decent street view from the correct spot, but this is our bay window: www.google.com/maps/preview#!q=Harcourt+Street%2C+Dublin%... And this is a view looking _in_ to Clonmel Street. www.google.com/maps/preview#!q=Harcourt+Street%2C+Dublin%...

comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/bernardhealy]....  Well done. That's probably the same letter box.
